snippet: The relatively short duration of matches compared with other sports — and the continuous action while they are being played — does not lend itself to lengthy commercial breaks.
abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column notes that World Cup soccer, with its constant action and lack of natural in-game stoppages, avoids the bloated commercial breaks of other sports on television; observes that soccer has its problems but length of its matches is not one.
lead_paragraph: The relatively short duration of matches compared with other sports — and the continuous action while they are being played — does not lend itself to lengthy commercial breaks.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: Soccer Broadcasts Have Fewer Commercials
headline.main: Tight Script of Soccer Isn’t Hostage to Advertisers
headline.print_headline: Tight Script of Soccer Isn’t Hostage to Advertisers
